tit.e: Omi Shinkanji-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound in Omi-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Gyoda City, Saitama Prefecture)
Omi Shinkanji-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound in Omi-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Gyoda City, Saitama Prefecture)

sen.j: 小見真観寺古墳（おみしんかんじこふん）は、埼玉県行田市の小見古墳群内にある前方後円墳である。
sen.e: The Omishinkanji Kofun (ancient tomb) is a zenpokoenfun (large keyhole-shaped tomb) located in Omi Kofun Group in Gyoda City, Saitama Prefecture.
The Omi Shinkanji-kofun Tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound located in Omi-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Gyoda City, Saitama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: The Omi Shinkanji-kofun Tumulus is a large keyhole-shaped mound located in Omi-kofun Tumuli Cluster in Gyoda City, Saitama Prefecture.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 墳丘長は112メートルであり、埼玉県第4位の規模を有する前方後円墳で、俗に「観音嶽」と称する。
sen.e: The mound of the tomb is 112 meters in length, a zenpokoenfun, ranking the fourth in size in Saitama Prefecture and commonly called "Kannon Dake (Mt. Goddess of Mercy)".
The mound of the tomb is 112 meters in length, a keyhole-shaped mound ranking the fourth in size in Saitama Prefecture and commonly called 'Kannon Dake' (Mt. Goddess of Mercy).
sen.cmt: 用語、クォーテーションを変えました。
sen.e: The mound of the tomb is 112 meters in length, a keyhole-shaped mound ranking the fourth in size in Saitama Prefecture and commonly called 'Kannon Dake' (Mt. Goddess of Mercy).

sen.j: 主軸は西北西に向かい、封土の左側および前後の頂部はともに削平を受けているが右側の遺存状況は良好である。
sen.e: The main axis points west northwest, and although the left-side mound and the front and back surfaces were flattened, the right side remainders are in good condition
The main axis points west northwest, and although the left-side mound and the tops of front and back are flattened, the right-side remainders are in good condition.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足し、補足しました。
sen.e: The main axis points west northwest, and although the left-side mound and the tops of front and back are flattened, the right-side remainders are in good condition.

sen.j: 後円部の径は55メートル、高さ7.8メートル、前方部の幅は48メートル、高さは7メートルである。
sen.e: The back circular part is 55 meters in diameter and 7.8 meters in height, and the front part 48 meters in width and 7 meters in height.
The back circular part is 55 meters in diameter and 7.8 meters in height, and the front square part 48 meters in width and 7 meters in height.
The back circular part is 55 meters in diameter and 7.8 meters in height, and the front square part 48 meters in width and 7 meters in height.

sen.j: 真言宗智山派慈雲山・真観寺の寺域にあるのでこの名がある。
sen.e: It was named so because it is in a temple region of Shinnkanji Temple/Shingon-shu Chizan-ha Shiunzan.
It was named so because it is in a temple region of Shinkan-ji Temple of Chizan school, Shingonshu sect on Mt. Shiun.
sen.cmt: 用語集、統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: It was named so because it is in a temple region of Shinkan-ji Temple of Chizan school, Shingonshu sect on Mt. Shiun.
Burial Facilities
Burial Facilities
Burial Facilities

sen.j: 埋葬施設は後円部と鞍部付近に緑泥片岩の一枚岩を組み合わせた二ヶ所の横穴式石室がある。
sen.e: The tomb has two corridor-style stone chambers built of chlorite schis monoliths fit together near the back circular part and the hollow part.
The mound has two corridor-style stone chambers built by fitting together some chrolite schist monoliths near the back circular part and the hollow part.
The mound has two corridor-style stone chambers built by fitting together some chrolite schist monoliths near the back circular part and the hollow part.

sen.j: 後円部の石室は1634年に発見され、前室・後室の構造で7世紀の初めの築造。
sen.e: In 1634 the stone chamber of the back circular part was discovered and it had a front room and a back room and was built in the early 7th century.
In 1634 the stone chamber of the back circular part was discovered and it had a front room and a back room and was built in the early seventh century.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: In 1634 the stone chamber of the back circular part was discovered and it had a front room and a back room and was built in the early seventh century.

sen.j: 前室 全長5.42メートル・幅2.24メートル・高さ2.03メートル
sen.e: The front room was 5.42 meters in full length, 2.24 meters in width, and 2.03 meters in height
The front room: 5.42 meters in full length, 2.24 meters in width, and 2.03 meters in height
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: The front room: 5.42 meters in full length, 2.24 meters in width, and 2.03 meters in height

sen.j: 後室 全長2.62メートル・幅2.33メートル・高さ2.02メートル
sen.e: The back room was 2.62 meters in full length, 2.23 meters in width and 2.02 meters in height.
The back room: 2.62 meters in full length, 2.33 meters in width and 2.02 meters in height
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、数値を原文に合わせました。
sen.e: The back room: 2.62 meters in full length, 2.33 meters in width and 2.02 meters in height

sen.j: 鞍部の石室は、後室のみが現存するが、前室については明らかではない。
sen.e: In the chamber in the hollow part a back room alone exists, while a front room remains unclear.
In the chamber in the hollow part a back room alone exists, while a front room remains unclear.
In the chamber in the hollow part a back room alone exists, while a front room remains unclear.

sen.j: 後室 全長2.8メートル・幅1.76メートル・高さ1.12メートル
sen.e: The back room was 2.8 meters in full length, 1.76 meters in width and 1.12 meters in height.
The back room: 2.8 meters in full length, 1.76 meters in width and 1.12 meters in height
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: The back room: 2.8 meters in full length, 1.76 meters in width and 1.12 meters in height

sen.j: 1880年（明治13年）、発掘調査がなされ、甲冑、刀剣、銅鋺、土器などの出土品は東京国立博物館に収蔵・展示されている。
sen.e: Excavation investigation in 1880 found armors, swords, copper bowls, earthen vessels, which are now stored and exhibited in Tokyo National Museum..
Excavation investigation in 1880 found some artifacts such as armors, swords, copper bowls, earthen vessels, which are now stored and exhibited in Tokyo National Museum.
Excavation investigation in 1880 found some artifacts such as armors, swords, copper bowls, earthen vessels, which are now stored and exhibited in Tokyo National Museum.

sen.j: 副葬品の編年から、鞍部石室の築造はやや遅れて7世紀の中頃の可能性がある。
sen.e: From the chronology of grave goods, there is a possibility that the stone chamber was built a little later in the middle of the 7th century.
From the chronology of grave goods, there is a possibility that the stone chamber was built a little later in the middle of the seventh century.
sen.cmt: スペルアウトしました。
sen.e: From the chronology of grave goods, there is a possibility that the stone chamber was built a little later in the middle of the seventh century.

sen.j: 前方後円墳としては新しい時期のものであり、さきたま古墳群に匹敵する首長墓と考えられている。
sen.e: This tomb is thought to be a one in a newer period as a zenpokoenfun and a headperson-class tomb equal to Sagitama Kofun Group.
It is new tumulus for a keyhole-shaped mound and is thought to be a headperson-class tomb equal to Sakitama-kofun Tumuli Cluster.
sen.cmt: 読み、表現を変えました。
sen.e: It is new tumulus for a keyhole-shaped mound and is thought to be a headperson-class tomb equal to Sakitama-kofun Tumuli Cluster.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）3月30日、国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: On March 30, 1931 it was designated as a national historic site.
On March 30, 1931 it was designated as a national historic site.
On March 30, 1931 it was designated as a national historic site.
